tool.name: AdjustAccumSimp

param.name: inletpoint
param.dialogReference: Input point feature class of the inlet location inlet. This point should be inside the HUC to be corrected, on the cell that receives flow from an upstream HUC.
param.pythonReference: Input point feature class of the inlet location inlet. This point should be inside the HUC to be corrected, on the cell that receives flow from an upstream HUC.

param.name: fdr
param.dialogReference: FDR grid for the HUC to be corrected.
param.pythonReference: FDR grid for the HUC to be corrected.

param.name: fac
param.dialogReference: FAC grid for the HUC to be corrected.
param.pythonReference: FAC grid for the HUC to be corrected.

param.name: filin
param.dialogReference: The cost surface grid for the HUC to be corrected. This should be the burned DEM from hydrodem (hydroDEM) that was used to generate the FDR.
param.pythonReference: The cost surface grid for the HUC to be corrected. This should be the burned DEM from hydrodem (hydroDEM) that was used to generate the FDR.

param.name: facout
param.dialogReference: A name for the output corrected FAC grid. The default is hydrodemfac_global. If there are multiple inlets, number each output hydrodemfac_global and use it as the source fac grid for subsequent runs. Make the final output named hydrodemfac_global. Be sure to keep the unadjusted fac grid named fac.
param.pythonReference: A name for the output corrected FAC grid. The default is hydrodemfac_global. If there are multiple inlets, number each output hydrodemfac_global and use it as the source fac grid for subsequent runs. Make the final output named hydrodemfac_global. Be sure to keep the unadjusted fac grid named fac.

param.name: incrval
param.dialogReference: The amount to add to the FAC cells in the HUC to be corrected. This would be the max value of the upstream HUC's fac grid. The number does not have to be the actual upstream accumulation value, but must be larger than the stream definition threshold, which is 150,000 cells by default (assuming 10-m grids).
param.pythonReference: The amount to add to the FAC cells in the HUC to be corrected. This would be the max value of the upstream HUC's fac grid. The number does not have to be the actual upstream accumulation value, but must be larger than the stream definition threshold, which is 150,000 cells by default (assuming 10-m grids).

tool.summary: Simplified flow accumulation adjustment tool. Takes a single point feature class as input, and adjusts fac downstream of that point using a lest-cost-path. Use this when the more automated Flow Accum Adjust tool fails. Make separate point feature classes for each inlet to process and use that as the input for Inlet Point.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Simplified flow accumulation adjustment tool. Takes a single point feature class as input, and adjusts fac downstream of that point using a lest-cost-path. Use this when the more automated Flow Accum Adjust tool fails. Make separate point feature classes for each inlet to process and use that as the input for Inlet Point.
